data.title: Upside-Down Keyboard.
data.statement:
At Accounting Company Manufacturing Co. :tm: (ACMC™), there is an office prank going around, where employees will turn the Keyboard & Numpad of their coworkers upside down (by rotating them 180 degrees).  All Keyboards at ACMC™ are of the {{QWERTY layout}}, and the Numpad/Keyboard are separate.

<<Example Keyboard & Numpad:>>
`                           *`
`Q W E R T Y U I O P    7 8 9`
`A S D F G H J K L ;    4 5 6`
`Z X C V B N M , . /    1 2 3`
`                       0    `


ACMC™ is constantly entering long-form [[Order Numbers]]. Sometimes without realizing that their keyboard and numpad are upside down! However, the ACMC™ staff is careful to only type from the middle row, which is {{ASDFGHJKL;}} and {{456}} (even if it's upside down, which would result in {{;LKJHGFDSA}} and {{654}}). 

Because of the pranksters, ACMC™ has entered a LOT of order numbers wrong....  Luckily! All hope is not lost! All order numbers at ACMC™ are meant to contain a {{0}}, and are only alphanumeric! Using this information, write a script to correct the order numbers!

<<Example:>>
{{TYUI}} being typed upside down, would result in: {{NBVC}}
{{10155}} would be {{9*955}}
{{LMAO}} would be {{SR;X}} 


<<Hints:>>
-[[orderNumber]] is only upside down if it contains a {{*}}.
-If the Keyboard is upside down, so is the Numpad (and vice versa)!
data.constraints:
- [[orderNumber]] will only contain UPPERCASE alphanumeric and {{,./;*}}
- [[orderNumberFixed]] will only be alphanumeric UPPERCASE
data.inputDescription: - [[orderNumber]] is a string that may have been entered by an upside down keyboard & numpad, and will always contain either {{0}} OR {{*}}. Never both.
data.outputDescription: [[orderNumberFixed]] is the corrected orderNumber as a string.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

At Accounting Company Manufacturing Co. :tm: (ACMC™), there is an office prank going around, where employees will turn the Keyboard & Numpad of their coworkers upside down (by rotating them 180 degrees). All Keyboards at ACMC™ are of the QWERTY layout, and the Numpad/Keyboard are separate.

Example Keyboard & Numpad:
                           *

Q W E R T Y U I O P    7 8 9

A S D F G H J K L ;    4 5 6

Z X C V B N M , . /    1 2 3

                       0



ACMC™ is constantly entering long-form Order Numbers. Sometimes without realizing that their keyboard and numpad are upside down! However, the ACMC™ staff is careful to only type from the middle row, which is ASDFGHJKL; and 456 (even if it's upside down, which would result in ;LKJHGFDSA and 654).

Because of the pranksters, ACMC™ has entered a LOT of order numbers wrong.... Luckily! All hope is not lost! All order numbers at ACMC™ are meant to contain a 0, and are only alphanumeric! Using this information, write a script to correct the order numbers!

Example:
TYUI being typed upside down, would result in: NBVC
10155 would be 9*955
LMAO would be SR;X


Hints:
-orderNumber is only upside down if it contains a *.
-If the Keyboard is upside down, so is the Numpad (and vice versa)!
Input
- orderNumber is a string that may have been entered by an upside down keyboard & numpad, and will always contain either 0 OR *. Never both.
Output
orderNumberFixed is the corrected orderNumber as a string.
Constraints
- orderNumber will only contain UPPERCASE alphanumeric and ,./;*
- orderNumberFixed will only be alphanumeric UPPERCASE
Example
Input
;9Y*I8K7,6J
Output
A1B0C2D3E4F
